Release!Finally

Well, I think The mod is in a state where I wouldn't mind releasing it. It is the first (of many) to have the recompiled Firespitter sounds, full credit for that to Snjo.

I have put together a little video to showcase it a bit.

Soon sometime next week I plan to update/release my other mods but with added, appropriate sounds, like the Tardis's VWORP, and the sounds of the various bridges. As always I have uploaded the mod to spaceport:

heres how to add sounds starvision!

HOW TO MAKE YOUR OWN SOUNDS:

Since the 0.20 version folder structure, many have thought that adding custom sounds is not possible. The thing is, it just was never documented. Thanks to Faark I found out how to do that.

Make a sound sample file in .wav or .ogg format (bitrate and frequency I THINK don't matter much but the standard is 48000 HZ, 16bit) and it MUST be named with "sound_" in front, for example "sound_srb.wav" (in my case).

You need to make folders part/Sounds in your part folder, IN YOUR PART FOLDER, another "part" yes.. Confusing, but here's how it should look like:

GameData/ModName/Parts/PartName/part/Sounds/sound_XXX.wav

(XXX is your sound's name obviously) Awkward and very space wasting to put another part folder, but it is the only way it works for now. This is something that devs should correct in the future.

In the config file (.cfg) of the part add:

sound_XXX = action

where "action" is something like "running" or "engage" or "flameout", refer to other .cfg-s for more actions. Make sure NOT TO PUT THE EXTENSION such as ".wav" in the config file otherwise, it won't work.

Release

I've been stripped of my free time the past couple days so I never got to release the mod, even though it was finished. But anyways, It's released now.

New stuff:

-IVA (courtesy of Boogaman)

-Sound (courtesy of the Firespitter plugin)

-Tech Tree integration (In the experimental rocketry node)

-Science! (complete experiments with full descriptions)

I'll try and get a video up sometime soon showcasing the features.
I think i will try this mod out now. It has SCIENCE AND SOUNDS.
The TARDIS has been updated with the recompiled Firespitter plugin and therefore has sound effects!

The Phoenix is crashing when I go on EVA. Furthermore, the kerbal roster thing is not appearing on the flight screen, and there are graphical glitches occuring on the navball (gray patches appearing (especially over the thrust indicator)). Is there a plugin I should have that I may be missing? I was using the non-RPM cockpit. I am downloading RPM, and will see if that works.

Edit:

Did not work. The crash log seems to be indicating an out-of-memory error. This is odd. I have plenty of free ram as long as I do not eva with the phoenix cockpit.

Also, AWESOME !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Edit 2:

the ksp.log file: it looks like after i am placed on the launchpad, it thinks I am in orbit around Kerbol, and it crashes on eva as it has position, velocity, and orientation all Nan

The Phoenix is crashing when I go on EVA. Furthermore, the kerbal roster thing is not appearing on the flight screen, and there are graphical glitches occuring on the navball (gray patches appearing (especially over the thrust indicator)). Is there a plugin I should have that I may be missing? I was using the non-RPM cockpit. I am downloading RPM, and will see if that works.

Edit:

Did not work. The crash log seems to be indicating an out-of-memory error. This is odd. I have plenty of free ram as long as I do not eva with the phoenix cockpit.

Also, AWESOME !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Edit 2:

the ksp.log file: it looks like after i am placed on the launchpad, it thinks I am in orbit around Kerbol, and it crashes on eva as it has position, velocity, and orientation all Nan

Do you have any other mods installed? I'll check it on my game with the download provided and report back. The only thing I can think of doing is re-installing the mod.

Edit: Mine seems to check out okay, even using the RPM cockpit when it isn't installed.

Edited March 4, 2014 by StarVision
I tried reinstalling, it works now. It seems that one of the internal files somehow did not get copied over. Thanks!

The original post has been updated. The Enterprise now functions properly in the newest update and has optional KSP Interstellar support. I've also managed to get the Phoenix on SpacePort after much frustration. It turns out when I scaled the Enterprise I was only looking at the size of the saucer, so the saucer was 300m, instead of the ship itself. That has been corrected.

The Ford Anglia has been updated for 0.23.5 after it was brought to my attention that there were some flaws with it.

Spaceport page is now up to date, whether it says so or not.

The Ford Anglia has been updated for 0.23.5 after it was brought to my attention that there were some flaws with it.

Spaceport page is now up to date, whether it says so or not.

Thanks Nodes are better but still a bit big, anyway, put the wheels in the right angle is easier than stock TR-2L one (which is quite hard because of it's low profile suspension).

The driver vertical speed display (the one below surface speed on the right, there is another one on the left :/ does it really need two ?) is upside-down in IVA.

Thanks Nodes are better but still a bit big, anyway, put the wheels in the right angle is easier than stock TR-2L one (which is quite hard because of it's low profile suspension).

The driver vertical speed display (the one below surface speed on the right, there is another one on the left :/ does it really need two ?) is upside-down in IVA.

Most of the time when I do Internals I just try and get all the normal stuff on there, then fill the rest of the space up with various rotated and scaled parts. If I didn't do this the IVA would look pretty bland. Of course I could model different doo-dads to fit in, but I was too lazy at the time to do anything.

Why is it that almost everyone here hates the new Star Trek movies/ships? The new Enterprise blows the other one out of the water (literally and visually), the Vengeance looks and is bad***. What some guys need to come to terms with is: it's Abrams' reboot, let him do what he wants. So far, he's done well. Just because the new ships don't fit into scale with their predecessors doesn't mean they should be completely disregarded. He (Abrams) started his reboot with a paradox that completely and totally changed the course of ST history, so don't be surprised if he goes completely off of the beaten track. He's not trying to amend to the previous generation, he's trying to present an old, worn out story for the new generation to enjoy, which requires massive changes. Also, rewritten star trek is better than no star trek.
